intro: Clinostigma thurstonii, commonly known as the Himalayan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Clinostigma thurstonii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
